result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel J Bukowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
No new law violations.
No contact with firearms.

Cooperate with agent. 
Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Court ordered defendant to register as a Sex Offender and can never have employment/volunteer where he will supervise or work with children.
Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor.
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

Pay Child Pornography image surcharge of $500.00 per image, total of SIX (6) Child Pornography image surcharge total surcharge of $3000.00 to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA SAMPLE and pay DNA SURCHARGE, payable from Defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the Department of Corrections (DOC). Remainder to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. CASH BAIL WILL APPLY
Pay supervision fees.
Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid ((during the period of probation. If revoked)), to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Restitution set at $0.00.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel J Bukowski

records.addlTxt: Credit of 40 days added per order signed 10/11/2022. and filed on 10/12/2022
Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in Judgment of Conviction; signed and filed.
records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: Defense counsel notified court regarding sentence credit. Clerk confirmed credit order. Clerk to complete request to correct the court record entry.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Samuel J Bukowski in court, in custody.  Attorney John Scott Schiro in court for Samuel J Bukowski.  Attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Sentencing hearing. Court reviewed Character Reference Letters and Sentencing Memorandum. State complied with Victim Notification. Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant. Additional Statements by: Hedi B.

AS TO COUNT 1:  
Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of SIX (6) YEARS.
The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is THREE (3) YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is THREE (3)YEARS.  

Court found Defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Court found Defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No new law violations. 
- Cooperate with agent. 
-Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid ((during the period of probation. If revoked)), to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court ordered defendant to register as a Sex Offender and can never have employment/volunteer where he will supervise or work with children.
Pay Child Pornography image surcharge of $500.00 per image, total of SIX (6) Child Pornography image surcharge total surcharge of $3000.00 to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
 
Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA SAMPLE and pay DNA SURCHARGE, payable from Defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the Department of Corrections (DOC). Remainder to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. CASH BAIL WILL APPLY.

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor.
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 
Court advised Defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; PreTrial Incarceration Credit; and Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Defendant's Sentencing Memorandum; received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Proposed Order to Seal, Filed.
Treatment Letter, Filed & Sealed
Proposed Order to Seal, Filed.
Motion to Seal, Filed.

Defendant Samuel J Bukowski in court.  Attorney John Scott Schiro in court for Samuel J Bukowski.  Prosecuting attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for the State of Wisconsin. AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Elements of the Offense/Jury instruction received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint.  Judgment of conviction entered.  
Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  The Court also advised the defendant that because he was convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29 he may not possess a firearm.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Pursuant to negotiations with the state, The Court will Dismiss but Read In Counts 2, 3, 4, 5, & 6 for purposes of sentencing.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Br 45.  Defendant Remanded.  mn
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Filed.
JI-2146A, Filed.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, Filed.
Br 45 will be down the after noon of 9/2, the plea hearing is rescheduled to 9/1/22 at 3:00.  Parties notified.   mn

Defendant Samuel J Bukowski in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Samuel J Bukowski appeared by video means.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requests an plea date.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB  Plea hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Samuel J Bukowski in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference held and adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
re bail refund

Defendant Samuel J Bukowski in court with Attorney John Scott Schiro; both appear by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.

Oral No Contact Order not to be unsupervised with any child under the age of 17 years old. Not to have acess to the internet unless it's for work or virtural court appearance.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Samuel J Bukowski in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
